title: PokeSharp - Home
queEsP1: It's a Pokémon fangame with a unique adventure. What are you waiting for?
queEsP2: Story, unique Pokémon, and entertaining unique NPCs.
textNpcs: You'll find NPCs throughout your adventure, completely new, real people with nods to things related to that person in real life.
text1Minigames: In the game, you'll find well-known and fun minigames, with which you can earn rewards or just have a good time.
pPropiedadFooter: All textures, images, and other assets used belong to their respective owners.
pAfiliadoFooter: PokeSharp is not affiliated with Nintendo, Game Freak, or The Pokémon Company.
faq1P1: You can play it initially on PC, and it might be available on mobile soon.
faq2P1: PokeSharp is a Pokémon fangame developed by a single person,
faq2P2: with the purpose of creating a game very different from other Pokémon fangames, making it innovative and fun.
faq3: 3. When will it be officially available?
faq3P1: PokeSharp is still under development, so there is no official release date yet.
faq3P2: You can follow the progress on the Discord server.
faq4P1: PokeSharp had many older facets, it started as attempts to create a Pokémon game by any means possible,
faq4P2: but it ultimately ended up being a final project for the DAM higher degree course.
faq5: 5. How did the idea come about?
faq5P1: The idea was created a year before its development, by someone other than the creator, it was Izan, my classmate,
faq5P2: who tried to create something using the terminal with Java. I decided to ask to join his project, and I worked on
faq5P3: the interfaces, but ultimately it couldn't be completed due to a lack of knowledge and time. A year later, we had
faq5P4: to make an individual project, so I asked him if I could continue starting from scratch in a different way. I got permission,
faq5P5: and I changed the name from PokeJava to PokeSharp since the previous plan was to make it in Java... and here we are.
faq6: 6. Where does the name PokeSharp come from?
faq6P1: The name PokeSharp comes from its older name, PokeJava, which I suggested at the time. Finally, when
faq6P2: changing the programming language, I decided to rename it PokeSharp because I liked it more.
faq7: 7. What do I need to play?
faq7P1: The minimum and recommended requirements are pending but should be quite accessible.
faq8P1: At the moment, it's not possible. In the future, if the project continues, it might be an option.
faq8P2: Any kind of suggestion or bug report is always appreciated if you'd like to help ^^
